original_title: Five Malicious Chrome Extensions Impersonate Workday and NetSuite to Hijack Accounts
selection_reasoning: This represents a sophisticated social engineering attack that exploits trust in familiar enterprise tools, offering lessons about digital mimicry and the dangers of trusted systems being counterfeited

field_note.title: The Merchant's False Seals
field_note.subtitle: When trusted writs become instruments of deception
field_note.excerpt: Five counterfeit enchantments masqueraded as legitimate merchant tools, stealing the very trust they claimed to protect.
field_note.epigraph: The most dangerous deceptions wear the faces we know best.
body_paragraphs: In the great marketplace of digital commerce, merchants have long relied upon enchanted seals to verify their transactions and protect their ledgers. These mystical tools, crafted by trusted artificers, bear the marks of legitimacy-familiar sigils, known names, the comfortable weight of routine. Yet it is precisely this trust that makes them so vulnerable to counterfeiting.

The recent discovery of five false seals, each bearing the likeness of renowned merchant houses like the Workday Guild and NetSuite Consortium, reveals the sophistication of modern deception. These counterfeits did not merely steal-they worked in concert, blocking the very alarm systems that might have exposed their presence. One seal would harvest authentication tokens while another silenced the watchers, creating a web of coordinated betrayal.

What makes this incursion particularly insidious is how it exploited the mundane nature of daily commerce. Workers, accustomed to using these familiar tools, installed the false seals without suspicion. The counterfeits even mimicked the appearance and basic functions of their legitimate counterparts, maintaining the illusion until the harvest was complete.

This pattern echoes throughout history-from forged royal writs in ancient kingdoms to counterfeit guild marks in medieval markets. The principle remains constant: trust, once systematized, becomes a weapon that can be turned against those who rely upon it. The most effective predators do not announce themselves with foreign faces, but wear masks we recognize and welcome.
